name: dialectically
content:
Add to word list

social sciences
  specialized in a way that tries to discover what is true by considering opposite theories: He thinks dialectically, rather than confrontationally. This argument was dialectically transformed into its opposite. Related words
dialectical
dialectic
formal in a way that involves two different things or ideas that exist together and affect each other: Organism and environment are dialectically interlocked. A citizen's rights exist dialectically alongside responsibilities to co-citizens.
More examplesFewer examplesFormal systems can guide thought dialectically.The different positions here are clearly dialectically related. They were much more articulate and dialectically skilful than most young scientists.
